taskman.backend.task

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskman.backend.task.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TaskWrapper

    public class Task
extends java.lang.Object
implements TaskWrapper
    This class represents a task.
    Author:
    Jeroen Van Der Donckt

    • Constructor Detail

      • Task

        public Task(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String description,
            long estimatedDuration,
            double acceptableDeviation)
        Creates a new task with the given values.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the task.
        description - the task description
        estimatedDuration - the estimated duration of the task in minutes
        acceptableDeviation - the acceptable deviation of the task
        Postcondition:
        a new task is created with the given attributes and unavailable status, empty dependencies list and a new plan

      • endExecution

        public void endExecution(java.time.LocalDateTime startTime,
                         java.time.LocalDateTime endTime,
                         java.lang.String status,
                         User user)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                         java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        End the execution of the task.
        Parameters:
        startTime - the start time of the task
        endTime - the end time of the task
        status - the new status of the task
        user - the user to update the task status for
        Postcondition:
        the time span and status of the task will be updated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • makeExecuting

        public void makeExecuting(ResourceManager resourceManager,
                          java.time.LocalDateTime startTime,
                          User user)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        makes a task executing
        Parameters:
        resourceManager - the resource manager to pass to the state
        startTime - the time when the task starts executing
        user - the user to check the assignment for
        Postcondition:
        the status of the task is changed to executing
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the user is not assigned to the task
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the plan cannot be rescheduled.

      • isAvailable

        public boolean isAvailable(ResourceManager resourceManager,
                           java.time.LocalDateTime startTime)
        Returns if this task is available.
        Parameters:
        resourceManager - a resource manager.
        startTime - a start time.
        Returns:
        true if this task is available, otherwise false.

      • removeDependency

        public void removeDependency(Task dependency)
        Removes dependency of the given task.
        Parameters:
        dependency - task that needs to be removed as dependency of the task
        Postcondition:
        the dependency is deleted from the task
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the dependency task must be a dependency of the task
